* Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.
* Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.
* If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/password-recovery if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.

title: Virtual Partner Account Manager- Scandinavia
description:
**Extreme Networks Named to Computerworld’s 2023 List of Best Places to Work in IT!**
 Over 50,000 customers globally trust our end-to-end, cloud-driven networking solutions and rely on our top-rated services and support to accelerate their digital transformation efforts and deliver progress like never before and with double digit growth year over year, no provider is better positioned to deliver better outcomes on scale, than Extreme.
   

  

 We believe in “walking the walk” of our strong core values which enable us to successfully advance together. Diversity and Inclusion is a vital part of our values and beliefs, and we’re proud to foster an environment where every Extreme employee can thrive.
   

  

 Come become part of something big with us! We are a global leader, with hubs in Europe, North America, South America, Asia Pacific, and the Middle East.
   

  

**THE ROLE – Manage Midsize and Small Partners**
 Has to develop relationships at various levels within assigned partners and further develop them and has to collaborate with the rest of the Sales team and technical delivery teams to bring our partners and customers the best solutions from across Extreme solutions and Services Portfolio
   

  

 Has to guide new onboarded channels through our NOAR process, find new potential partners for growing regional strategy and develop relationships at various levels within them; has to align with the rest of sales team and technical delivery teams to bring our partners and customers the best solutions from across Extreme solutions and Services Portfolio
   

  

**Role Responsibilities**
* Align channel strategy with regional sales goals and sales team to increase revenue in assigned territory
* Assigned partners to prioritize tasks for growing strategy in assigned region. Track top performing partners for regional grow, build and align relation with them. Align business plan with regular (quarterly) review of goals and action plans. Ensure day-to-day visibility and timely response within their accounts and build relationship within partner's organization.
* Acquisition of partners; Working with regional teams to identify the gap in channel coverage; lead the onboarding process of new potential partners supported by another Extreme functional teams and local distribution
* Evangelize the Proposition; align partners with Extreme strategy and solutions; host regular updates, conference calls, events, activities for channel partners to review new Extreme Networks product or programs, updates, trainings concerns, marketing activities and any concerns that need to be addressed supported by sales and technical resources
* Closing sales together with sales team in assigned opportunities; mapping partners against opportunities, tracking longtail pipeline together with distributors and distribution team, handling forecast for assigned tracking criteria
* Guidance as primary internal Extreme contact person with another Extreme teams regarding escalations and issues, RMAs, services, sales tool development, trainings, order operations, etc.
* Partner program ambassador; utilize available programs and initiatives, organize regular updates for channels in assigned territory together with partner program team
* Ensure partners compliancy and enablement regarding partner program
* Develop sales pipeline and channel capability using available Extreme development funds; execute marketing plans together with regional marketing manager to promote Extreme Network and regional goals
* Coordinate and track all major channel activities in assigned territory
* Regional channel librarian – day-to-day resource for partner communication and updates, assign their request to proper Extreme resources
* Distribution alliance together with distribution team to support channels via aligned distribution strategy in assigned region
* Drive our rules of Engagement with Channel Partners’ to/from, Inside Sales, Account executives, System engineers and others as appropriate internally and within the partner.


**Core Skills**
* Ability to grade and identify partners with the highest potential to growth
* Capability to drive the partner’s journey towards the Autonomous Partner
* Ability to build a trusted and strong relation with the top performing partners and distributors
* Organize QBR’s and align business plans with the top performing partners
* Managing expectations between partners, sales team and Distribution
* Strong presentation skills in positioning Extreme’s value propositions.
* Leverage internal tools ( Clari, SFDC, Tableau..) to analyze data and track consistency with the plan
* Channel Forecasting ( pag.5, chapter 7)
* Partner enablement and “Welcome New Partners” webinars
* Re-Engagement process on the defined Dormant partner in your region


**METRICS**
* Assigned Partners performance: Revenue achievement as per Partner AOP
* Assigned Partners total pipeline growth
* Marketing excellence: MDF Usage, Pipeline creation, Nurturing and reporting
* Training and enablement: Certification
* Autonomous Partner: DR level, Quote from partners (Iris), Channel Self-Service tool usage
* Personal development: Dojo points / Belt achievement
* Numbers of IgniteTech / IgniteSales: Technical and Sales people from partners joining & following to Ignite community

title: Senior Product Marketing Manager, Trilogy (Remote) - $400,000/year USD
description:
Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, Trilogy. Have you got what it takes?
   

  

 If you think most CEOs are full of themselves (and full of other stuff)... keep reading.
   

  

 Here’s a CEO track that requires — and actually rewards — zero experience being a CEO. In this role, you’ll become an incredibly effective, customer-facing CEO in an environment with more than 100 software products.
   

  

 Who You Are
   

  

 You’ve never been a CEO before. Probably because most of the time, “CEO” is just a 3-letter code for “an exhausting hamster wheel of team building and internal operations logistics.” And hopping on that hamster wheel would be a huge waste of your talent and potential.
   

  

 You’re smart. You keep things clear and direct. And while you’ve worked in SaaS for many years, you don’t have a decade of outdated “leadership” learnings to unlearn. You’re ready to be the leader that smart employees like you have been waiting for. This job right here is your launchpad.
   

  

 You're a generative AI power user. You've used ChatGPT, Claude, Bard, or a similar tool to automate previously manual workflows (note: this role does not require a software development background).
   

  

 You should already be well on your way to building a strong personal brand. We believe in the importance of a personal brand, and we’ll help you develop yours. You should understand the benefits and impact of a personal brand, the long-tail nature of content, and the effort it takes.
   

  

 You have experience with quickly moving products, particularly in leadership roles during the launch of epic new features. If you’ve been part of teams going from Seed through Series A/B rounds, that’s a huge plus. You’ve got proven ability to get customers excited about new product features and have used metrics like net dollar retention and win-back rates (and others) to measure the impact of new product features.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
* Implementing AI-driven Productivity Improvements: Utilizing generative AI tools to streamline and automate various workflows across the company.
* Customer Engagement and Feedback: Interacting with customers to gather insights and feedback, and using this information to enhance product offerings.
* Develop a Personal Monopoly: Publishing podcast episodes and blog posts and building a social media following to evangelize your portfolio's AI-driven products.


**What You Won’t Be Doing**
* Busywork that drains your creativity.
* Day-in, day-out team management or internal operations that distract from your vision.
* Tinker with the business model to figure out what works. (Remember, we’re giving you the playbook.)


**Basic Requirements**
**Senior Product Marketing Manager key responsibilities**
* At least 8 years of work experience in the enterprise software industry
* Leadership experience in marketing, sales, business development, partnerships, professional services, or another hands-on customer-facing domain
* Experience using generative AI tools to achieve quantifiable productivity improvements
* Currently based in North America, South America, or Europe


**About Trilogy**
 Hundreds of software businesses run on the Trilogy Business Platform. For three decades, Trilogy has been known for 3 things: Relentlessly seeking top talent, Innovating new technology, and incubating new businesses. Our technological innovation is spearheaded by a passion for simple customer-facing designs. Our incubation of new businesses ranges from entirely new moon-shot ideas to rearchitecting existing projects for today's modern cloud-based stack. Trilogy is a place where you can be surrounded with great people, be proud of doing great work, and grow your career by leaps and bounds.
   

  

 There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!
   

  

**Working with Crossover**
 This is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $200 USD/hour, which equates to $400,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.
   

  

**What to expect next:**
* You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.
* Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.


**Important!** 
 If you do not receive an email from us:
   

  

* First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.
* Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.
* Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.
* If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/password-recovery if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.


 Crossover Job Code: LJ-4649-SE-Stockhol-SeniorProductM.002

title: Manager Regional Demand Generation and Campaigns (Nordics)
description:
**An Introduction to Papirfly**
 Since our inception in Sandnes, Norway in 2000, we’ve grown to become a European leader within the MarTech landscape. Our mission is simple yet ambitious: to revolutionise brand management with our intuitive cloud-based platform. It's designed to let businesses effortlessly create, modify, store, and share their brand assets, making brand consistency easier than ever. With over a million users globally, our impact is clear, especially among renowned brands like BMW, Boston Consulting Group, and Unilever, who are part of our 500+ brand family.
   

  

 Our journey took an exciting turn in 2021 when we merged with BrandMaster, birthing the Papirfly Group. This expansion, coupled with welcoming companies like Meriworks, Brandpad and recently Keepeek, illustrates our commitment to innovation and growth. Under the leadership of our new CEO Stefan Ropers, a MarTech and SaaS industry veteran, we're honing our platform to be even more efficient and user-centric.
   

  

 At Papirfly, you'll become part of a dedicated team of nearly 300 professionals across eight countries, all committed to making a mark in the MarTech industry. In our culture, we emphasise a growth mindset, leadership, ownership, openness, and collaboration. This means we continually embrace challenges, learn, provide and accept feedback, and take pride in our work, encouraging each team member to lead and inspire.
   

  

 We value innovation, but it's the collective effort and diverse perspectives that truly drive our success. We believe in transparency, sharing information freely, and respecting each other's ideas to foster a collaborative environment. At Papirfly, your contributions are integral to our mission of redefining brand management and supporting our clients' success.
   

  

 Join us if you're ready to be part of a team where your personal growth and our shared achievements go hand in hand. At Papirfly, your ideas are important, your development is a priority, and together, we'll accomplish great things in the realm of brand management.
   

  

**Job Overview**
 The importance of creating and managing demand generation through the execution of integrated campaigns has increased dramatically as the focus of B to B marketing is shifting towards engagement creation, contextual marketing and lifecycle marketing. Papirfly is creating a new regional/country marketing team to execute campaigns through multichannel marketing, building on these new trends.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
 The Manager Regional Demand Generation and Campaigns will be accountable for creating an end to end regional/country marketing plan. This includes campaign architecture, execution, delivery and measurement across all channels.
   

  

* Creating the regional/country marketing plan
* Identifying and executing the right mix between Inbound Marketing, Account Based Marketing and Agency (Partner) Marketing.
* Planning and executing the go-to-market strategy and marketing calendar jointly with regional sales and SDR team.
* Planning, creating, executing, monitoring, testing and improving performance across all marketing channels for your respective regions; optimising end to end integrated campaigns.
* Driving audience segmentation and targeting inline with agreed ideal customer profiles, positioning, and use cases.
* Developing the content strategy adjacent to the integrated marketing mix of online elements for each stage of the customer journey, together with the story and product marketing team and other regional marketing managers.
* Initiating partnership with the story and product marketing team and the design team on the production of bill of materials (BOM's). Including e-cards, landing pages, white papers, webinars, sales/SDR assets and agency/partner assets. This includes the initial draft creation of selected bill of materials to scale the production of our content and campaign machinery.


 In order to be successful, this person must collaborate tightly across the entire marketing team, SDR team and sales team to form deep partnerships. Success will be measured by the effectiveness of our campaigns (ROI) and the achievement of demand generation goals.
   

  

**Knowledge And Experience Required**
* Degree in Marketing or related
* 7 to 10 years relevant experience for a software or technology provider
* Comfortable with executing, yet capable of also influencing others for joint results
* Exceptional (English) communication skills: must be able to articulate in a clear, persuasive argument, orally or in writing.
* Understanding of modern sales and marketing technology and tools, like the use of CRM systems and marketing automation system.
* Based in Sweden or Oslo.


**Our values**
**Growth Mindset**
 Our abilities and the outcomes we deliver can grow by accepting new challenges, being persistent, continuously learning and receiving feedback.
   

  

**Leadership**
 We are empowered to lead. We take action and motivate others around us.
   

  

**Ownership**
 We take pride in our dedication and commitment to our roles and responsibilities, ensuring we complete our tasks efficiently and responsively.
   

  

**Openness**
 We embrace transparency and openness, sharing key information and valuing each other's ideas.
   

  

**Collaboration**
 Together, we combine different skills and perspectives to achieve shared goals with respect and teamwork.

title: Controller till bolag verksamt inom greentech
description:
*Vill du arbeta i en affärsnära roll i ett bolag verksamt inom greentech? Kul – då kan rollen som Controller hos en av våra kunder vara din chans. Anställning direkt hos kund.*
 Bolaget grundades med en stark miljöhänsyn och ambitionen att hjälpa organisationer att uppnå sina unika miljömål. Dessutom donerar vi 10% av vår vinst till välgörenhet. Vi befinner oss i en expansiv tillväxtfas, vilket skapar utmärkta möjligheter för rätt kandidat att utvecklas och växa inom organisationen under de kommande åren. Som en del av vår tillväxt söker vi nu en Controller som vill vara med på vår spännande resa.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 I rollen som Controller har du en central och strategiskt viktig funktion. Du kommer att arbeta nära vår CFO och ha samarbeten inom hela företaget. Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter kommer att inkludera:
   

  

* Intäkts- och kostnadsanalyser samt finansiell uppföljning
* Lönsamhetsanalyser
* Uppföljning av projektekonomi
* Budget- och prognosarbete
* Bokslutsarbete
* Kalkylering
* Bygga rapporter i proaktivt syfte


 Utöver dessa arbetsuppgifter kommer du att driva och medverka i olika projekt som till exempel rutiner för löner, administrativa processer och IT-system.
   

  

 Du rapporterar till CFO och är placerad på bolagets kontor i Kista, Stockholm. Möjlighet till hybridarbete 2 dgr/vecka.
   

  

 Detta är en unik möjlighet att bidra till företagets framgång och utvecklas i en dynamisk och expansiv miljö.
   

  

**Vem söker vi?**
 Vi söker dig som arbetar i en liknande roll idag, eller som har några års erfarenhet inom ett annat ekonomirelaterat yrke med nära koppling till verksamheten. Du trivs med att förstå och analysera verksamheten och ser sambandet mellan det operationella och det finansiella. Du är ambitiös och vill utvecklas, med sikte på att utöka ditt ansvarsområde framöver.
   

  

 Vi tror att du har:
   

  

* Minst tre års erfarenhet som controller eller annat relevant ekonomirelaterat yrke
* God kunskap om grundläggande redovisningsarbete
* God IT/systemvana, samt erfarenhet från redovisningssystem, gärna Fortnox
* Hög kompetens inom Excel
* Högskoleutbildning inom ekonomi
* Mycket god svenska och engelska i tal och skrift


 Det är också meriterande med:
   

  

* Erfarenhet från konsultbolag, dvs att ha arbetat som ekonomikonsult
* Erfarenhet av att driva utvecklingsprojekt


 Du är analytisk, noggrann och strukturerad, och trivs i en roll som kräver både stort fokus och sociala kontakter, både internt och externt. Erfarenhet från arbete i bolag i en tillväxtfas är ett plus, då processer och strukturer fortfarande skapas och förbättras.
   

  

**Har vi väckt ditt intresse?**
 Den här rekryteringen sköts av SEVR Finance Recruitment men anställning är direkt hos kund.
   

  

 Urval och intervjuer sker löpande så skicka gärna in din ansökan så snart som möjligt. Har du frågor eller funderingar gällande rekryteringsprocessen eller tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta rekryteringskonsult Elin Lindén via elin.linden@sevr.se eller Anna Klimenko via anna.klimenko@sevr.se.
   

  

 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

 Ansök via www.sevr.se

title: Senior Value Consultant (Sweden)
description:
We're Celonis, the global leader in Process Mining technology and one of the world's fastest-growing SaaS firms. We believe there is a massive opportunity to unlock productivity by placing data and intelligence at the core of business processes - and for that, we need you to join us.
   

  

**The Team:**
 As a
 **Senior Value Consultant (Sweden)** 
 you'll be joining our Nordics Value Engineering function, based in Stockholm. This function is part of the wider Value Engineering organisation at Celonis. The position of Value Engineer is a trusted advisor helping customers achieve their strategic goals and realise significant value using the Celonis Process Intelligence. A Value Engineer has full responsibility for the end-to-end value journey of our customers – landing, expanding, adopting and renewing. Responsibilities include translating customers’ objectives into value assessments or proof-of-value projects, building specific Celonis business cases and demos, running value workshops, and engaging with multiple senior stakeholders to deliver value driven results and secure long term partnership agreements.
   

  

**The Role:**
 As a
 **Senior** 
**Value Consultant (Sweden)** 
 you are spearheading our mission of data-driven business transformation with our customers. You will work in partnership with the Celonis Sales Teams and have full responsibility for the end-to-end value journey of our customers. You are our customers trusted advisor and help them achieve their strategic goals and realize significant value using Celonis Process Intelligence. In collaboration with our partners and Celonis Services, you will drive measurable business impact across various processes and industries and accelerate the adoption of our platform. You will blend deep process and industry expertise with a proven consulting skill set with strong analytical skills at the forefront of one of the fastest-growing tech companies worldwide.
   

  

**The work you’ll do:**
**Identify & Frame Value**
* Discover and translate customers’ strategic priorities into high-impact Celonis use cases
* Build demos and business cases, leveraging industry benchmarks and best practices in order to win new customers
* Undertake Value Assessments or Proof-of-Value Projects and communicate the value opportunity and strategic roadmap to C-Level executives


**Realize Value**
* Facilitate business value workshops and use Celonis to identify and qualify opportunities for process enhancement
* Derive improvement measures in core business functions and initiate improvement actions and enterprise-wide change initiatives
* Present results and realized value to senior management and C-level executives


**Scale Value**
* Responsible for the end-to-end customer value journey, landing, expanding, adoption and renewing
* Build a strategic expansion roadmap for customers embedding Celonis Process Intelligence as a strategic business transformation platform in their organization and therefore drive adoption and expansion
* Provide feedback to our product development teams to enhance the Celonis platform and Apps based on new use cases


**The qualifications you need:**
* Live for Customer Value: Several years experience in an analytical role with the objective to demonstrate or secure value through business data analysis / analytics, business process improvement and respective Software deployment . Ideally in a customer-facing role in Solution Consulting, Sales Engineering or IT/Management Consulting with a Software provider or a Consultancy. Alternatively in an inhouse role (e.g. Center of Excellence for Data Mining / Analytics / Intelligence) within an Enterprise
* Data, Analytics, Applications & IT: Good knowledge of Business Software applications and experience in using and/ or building dashboards, Apps and Action Flows. Experience in collaborating with IT teams Process Improvement & Value Realization: Experience in identifying use cases for business process improvement and deploying improvement measures, being a change agent and training users/process owners to realize value
* Project Management: Experience in planning and managing project scopes, expectations and timelines. You will manage multiple projects across your aligned accounts that will be at different parts of the value journey. Also, you will leverage partners from the Celonis Ecosystem wherever possible
* Executive Stakeholder Management: Experience in preparing and communicating (value) roadmaps and results to stakeholders and management, both internally and externally. Excellent communication and presentation skills in English and either Finnish or Swedish
* Business Domain Expertise: Deep understanding of the Finance and/or Supply Chain domain as well as strategic transformation initiatives (e.g. Shared Services Transformation or System Transformation)
* Industry Expertise: Expertise in one or more industries (e.g. Manufacturing, Automotive, Consumer, Retail, Pharmaceuticals, Chemicals) and the ability to develop a deep understanding of industry trends and strategic opportunities
* Degree in a relevant field such as Technology & Management, Industrial/Business Engineering, Business Informatics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Economics or a comparable degree program


**What Celonis can offer you:**
* The unique opportunity to work with industry-leading process mining technology
* Investment in your personal growth and skill development (clear career paths, internal mobility opportunities, L&D platform, mentorships, and more)
* Great compensation and benefits packages (equity (restricted stock units), life insurance, time off, generous leave for new parents from day one, and more)
* Physical and mental well-being support (subsidized gym membership, access to counseling, virtual events on well-being topics, and more)
* A global and growing team of Celonauts from diverse backgrounds to learn from and work with
* An open-minded culture with innovative, autonomous teams
* Business Resource Groups to help you feel connected, valued and seen (Black@Celonis, Women@Celonis, Parents@Celonis, Pride@Celonis, Resilience@Celonis, and more)
* A clear set of company values that guide everything we do: Live for Customer Value, The Best Team Wins, We Own It, and Earth Is Our Future


**About Us**
 Since 2011, Celonis has helped thousands of the world's largest and most valued companies deliver immediate cash impact, radically improve customer experience and reduce carbon emissions. Its Process Intelligence platform uses industry-leading process mining technology and AI to present companies with a living digital twin of their end-to-end processes. For the first time, everyone in an organisation has a common language about how the business works, visibility into where value is hidden and the ability to capture it. Celonis is headquartered in Munich (Germany) and New York (USA) and has more than 20 offices worldwide.
   

  

 Get familiar with the Celonis Process Intelligence Platform by watching this video.
   

  

 Join us as we make processes work for people, companies and the planet.
   

  

 Celonis is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Different makes us better.
   

  

 Accessibility and Candidate Notices

title: Senior Product Designer
description:
Trustly is leading the human-centric payments revolution. To us, this means passionately building the most convenient, intelligent and responsible way of paying for things online. Whether it’s for shopping, paying subscriptions, funding trading accounts, booking airfare, playing online games and much more – we’re all about a better way to pay. At our core, we are a tech company with industry-leading tech capabilities. But, it’s the ingenuity of our people that makes us leaders in our field. Thus, our appetite for innovation will never be anything less than fierce. Trustly is steadily growing as it connects thousands of businesses with hundreds of millions of people. And with a strong presence across Europe and the Americas, we are leading the human-centric payment revolution as a truly global team.
 




  





**About the Role**









 We are looking for an ambitious Product Designer who can function as a design lead for the Merchant Experience team and contribute to strategic product initiatives.
 





 You will need to be able to paint with broad strokes when exploring new directions, and be able to get into the nitty gritty details when needed.  You will be reporting directly to the VP of Product.
 








**About the Product Design Team** 









 The Product Design team at Trustly is a tightly knit and forward leaning group of product obsessed talents. We’re responsible for the proactive gathering of insights that can lead to new ideas and improvements, supporting driving product vision, creating world-class product design, as well as working closely with product teams to achieve their day-to-day objectives.
 





  




**What you’ll do** 
* Lead the design framework in collaboration with your design colleagues
* Assist in driving the future visual expression of our products
* Conduct audits of our UI, visuals and design system
* Work closely with our product and engineering teams
* Be an advocate of the importance of Design Systems



  




**Who you are** 
* 5+ years experience in product design with a clear track record of impact
* Impeccably high standards for our product design
* Lead with curiosity
* Passionate about understanding products and their users
* Can balance visionary work with detailed and speedy hands-on design work
* A good communicator that easily builds connection and trust with teams and stakeholders
* Ready to take a stance, but can be pragmatic when it comes to how products evolve






  




  


**Apply now with your portfolio and CV in English - we would love to talk to you!** 




  






 Are you someone who voices new ideas and acts on them? Do you value great communication with all stakeholders? We are looking to strengthen the team with dedicated, highly motivated people who thrive in working with different areas across the organisation.
 









 If you feel that your skill set and personality compliments the criteria above, please apply now.

title: Senior Manager Development Dynamic Production (f/m/d)
description:
***\*Feel free to apply in English or German.\****
 The TUI Group is the global leader in integrated tourism business. The Dynamic Business Development Team manages and coordinates connectivities to dynamic accommodation suppliers as well as future development of related capabilities and therefore shapes the future of the TUI accommodation product on sale. We are an international team of experts who have ownership of the development and continuous improvement of business models and processes for all product areas of TUI Source Markets using dynamically sourced accommodations on common platforms.
   

  

 Our main goal is to offer our clients the best dynamic accommodation product for their needs and ensure the best possible cooperation with our suppliers.
   

  

 Become part of the Dynamic Business Development Team and actively shape our success. We are looking for a Manager Development Dynamic Production (m/f/d) as soon as possible.
   

  

**About The Job**
* You will be accountable for managing and coordinating new connectivities to dynamic accommodation suppliers (eg bedbanks, channelmanagers) as well as future development of existing connectivities.
* You will act as Key Account Manager for your dedicated dynamic accommodation suppliers. You will build a reliable partnership to them and related service providers to continuously optimize the cooperation in overall technical-process-related issues.
* You will stay close to the operational and commercial performance of connectivities and capabilities you have delivered to ensure you understand where things can be further improved and to ensure the capabilities are being fully utilised.
* You will support the Holiday Product Lead / Head of Development Dynamic in successful definition, planning and delivery of key capabilities needed in an end-to-end production flow for dynamic accommodations by continuously providing input and requirements to the product owners of services and keeping the overview on delivery and timelines for your dedicated capabilities.
* You will balance the demand between regional and multi-regional needs, set the scope of any changes, and where required, be responsible for making trade-offs based on data driven insight to ensure we hit the dates and achieve the stated benefits and objectives.
* You will work on the design of end-to-end processes to produce and fulfil bookings with dynamically sourced accommodations across all downstream teams
* You will participate in or lead local and international projects regarding the further development and expansion of the dynamic production with dynamic accommodation suppliers.
* You will create decision-making documents for management with evaluations and recommendations on concrete further development ideas or strategic questions within the framework of the optimization of dynamic production (in coordination with other departments and IT management).


**What You Bring**
* Commercial or tourism education, ideally university studies in economics
* A confident professional with several years of relevant professional experience in tourism and a strong network in at least one of TUI’s source markets, preferably in the Northern Region or Western Region
* Extensive knowledge of the hotel and tourism industry, especially about structures and competitors in the dynamic part of the market
* Ideally experience in cooperation with external partners and strong network among dynamic accomodation partners (especially Bedbanks, Hotelchains, Channelmanagers, Technology providers)
* Experience in ownership and improvement of complex processes
* Solid knowledge in project management and basic knowledge in agile software development techniques
* Solid knowledge in the MS Office programs (Excel, Powerpoint, Outlook, OneNote) and TUI systems (especially Desti Acco Service, @comRes, Spotfire, Tableau, Jira, Confluence)
* The role requires fluent business English (written & spoken)


**More About You**
* Strong relationship building skills in an international environment, with experience of handling multiple stakeholders
* High IT affinity and interested in complex technical contexts; ability to translate business requirements into IT capability requests
* Excellent communicator, both verbal and written and with a strong understanding of cultural aspects across all TUI markets
* Ability to deal with conflicts, identify blockages and obstacles in the partner and IT relationship and create win win solutions to overcome them
* Personality that thrives in fast paced environments and is able to quickly adapt to priority changes
* Strong customer focus mixed with commercial and strategic understanding
* Strong analytical and conceptual skills
* Excellent organizational skills as well as a structured and prioritized approach to work


**About Our Offer**
* Working in the leading global tourism group: We stand for intercultural cooperation and offer the opportunity to work in international projects and teams.
* Mobile working and flexible working hours: We believe that work is something you do, not where you go. Our offer: newWork@TUI (hybrid working) & TUI Workwide (Working from abroad)
* Development and career opportunities: We promote the potential of our employees with a wide range of (digital) training opportunities and international career opportunities.
* Personal benefits: We offer attractive remuneration with holiday bonus, generous travel benefits, extensive health & wellbeing offers and much more.


 We love to see your uniqueness shine through and inspire the future of travel. If you would like to read more about what Diversity & Inclusion means to us simply visit Our DNA.

title: BA Business Controller Buildings
description:
**Företagsbeskrivning**
 AFRY erbjuder tjänster inom teknik, design, digitalisering och rådgivning. Vi är experter inom industri, energi- och infrastruktur, som skapar värde för kommande generationer. AFRY har en global räckvidd med djupa rötter i Norden. Tillsammans accelererar vi omställningen till ett mer hållbart samhälle.
   

  

**Jobbeskrivning**
 AFRY söker nu en BA Business Controller för affärsområdet Buildings i en affärsnära roll där du har ansvar för den ekonomiska styrningen och planeringen utifrån ett kort- och långsiktigt perspektiv. Du har en nyckelroll i att stödja affärsområdets ledning genom finansiell analys, rapportering och strategiskt planering samt vara en del av strategiska affärsbeslut. Rollen kräver både en djup förståelse för ekonomiska principer, en förmåga att tillämpa dem och att driva förbättringar i såväl processflöden som lönsamhet.
   

  

 Som BA Business Controller i affärsområdet Buildings kommer du att tillhöra AFRYs största division Infrastructure. Rollen innefattar ett övergripande ansvaret för affärsområdet ur ett finansperspektiv. En del av rollen är att agera bollplank, coacha och utbilda chefer i verksamheten för att ständigt öka förmågan att fatta affärsmässiga beslut. Som BA Business Controller bidrar du till att säkerställa affärsområdets finansiella framgång genom att erbjuda strategiskt stöd och insiktsfull analys
   

  

 Du ingår i ett team med ett tiotal controllers, varav ett par kommer att stötta dig med business controlling inom Buildings affärsområde. I din roll rapporterar du till VP Head of Finance. Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter kommer bl a att innefatta:
   

  

* Sammanställa och analysera finansiella resultat, nyckeltal och identifiera avvikelser
* Förbereda månads- och kvartalsrapportering
* Analysera budget och prognoser
* Delta i strategisk planering och bidra med finansiella insikter och analys
* Identifiera och analysera kostnadsbesparingsmöjligheter och effektiviseringspotential för att öka lönsamhet och processeffektivitet
* Producera och kommunicera olika finansiella analyser som stöder effektivt beslutsfattande
* Identifiera aktiviteter och åtgärder som ökar verksamhetens resultat, lönsamhet och kassaflöde
* Identifiera finansiella risker och föreslå åtgärder för att minimera dessa samt säkerställa att interna kontroller utvecklas och följs upp
* Ansvara för budget samt prognosarbetet inom affärsområdet
* Ingå i affärsområdets ledningsgrupp såväl som divisionens controller team.
* Driva verksamhets- och projektuppföljning
* Stötta specifika projekt med ekonomisk expertis, hålla utbildning, bolagsförvärv m m


 Du rapporterar till divisionens VP, Head of Finance och din placeringsort är Solna.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
* Du är prestigelös och nyfiken lagspelare som är trygg i din yrkesroll. Du är duktig på att bygga relationer och har hög integritet. Du är utvecklingsorienterad och är en duktig förändringsledare.
* För att trivas i rollen behöver du vara resultatorienterad och ha förmågan att ta ägarskap av uppgifter och förmåga att driva dem självständigt. Du har en mycket god analytisk förmåga och kan kommunicera ekonomi till andra på ett pedagogiskt sätt.
* Du är civilekonom eller motsvarande och har 7 års erfarenhet av liknande roller och arbetsuppgifter inom en stor organisation. Du har en grund inom redovisning, mycket goda kunskaper i Excel samt förmåga och erfarenhet av att hantera och analysera stora datamängder.
* Du kommunicerar på svenska och engelska obehindrat i såväl tal som skrift. Erfarenhet av internationellt arbete är meriterande. Ett extra plus om du har erfarenhet av projekt med successiv vinstavräkning, exponering byggverksamhet samt erfarenhet från konsultverksamhet


**Ytterligare information**
 Vi erbjuder en arbetsplats och ett team som bäst kan beskrivas som professionella, affärsmässiga och som har roligt tillsammans!
   

  

 AFRY rankas som en av Sveriges mest populära arbetsgivare. Vi vet att medarbetare som mår bra, både fysiskt som psykiskt, är den viktigaste framgångsfaktorn. Därför fokuserar vi på säker arbetsmiljö och balans mellan arbete och fritid. Vi vill att du ska ha en vardag som fungerar - hinna lämna, hämta, träna, handla eller bara sova lite längre på morgonen.
   

  

 Genom Club AFRY främjar vi vår kultur som bygger på passion och lagspel. Vi erbjuder roliga fritidsaktiviteter tillsammans med våra härliga kollegor! Vårt arbete med mångfald är ständigt pågående. En mix av personligheter och bakgrunder gör oss ännu starkare, mer kreativa och framgångsrika ute på marknaden.
   

  

 Sista ansökningsdag är 13/8-2024. Vi kommer börja intervjua kandidater tidigast från mitten av augusti, men skicka gärna din ansökan redan idag!
   

  

 Kontaktuppgifter för frågor kring rollen
   

  

 Anne Kinnander - VP Head of Finance
   

  

 +46 10 505 49 08
   

  

 anne.n.kinnander@afry.com
   

  

 Kontaktuppgifter för frågor kring processen
   

  

**Lena Dalenius**
 VP Head of HR Division Infrastructure
   

  

 lena.dalenius@afry.com
   

  

 +46 72 201 93 48
   

  

 Vi undanber oss direktkontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt säljare av ytterligare jobbannonser.
   

  

*På AFRY driver vi förändring i allt vi gör. Vi anser att förändring sker när modiga idéer möts, när vi samarbetar, skapar innovation och omfamnar kreativa lösningar, det är så vi skapar framtiden. Vi söker konstant kvalificerade kandidater som vill ansluta sig till våra inkluderande team runt om i världen. Bli en del av oss och påskynda den gröna omställningen*

title: Senior Group Business Controller
description:
**Job Description**
 At Billerud we believe that when we have tomorrow in mind, we will do our very best today. It is thanks to our employees that we are a world-leading company within the field of renewable paper and packaging materials. Do you want to realize your true value and work for a sustainable tomorrow? Join us!
   

  

**We are looking for a Senior Group Business Controller to join our Group Finance function.**
 Group Finance is responsible all for Group controlling and reporting activities, performance management and a wide range of finance development projects throughout the company. The Group Business Control team is is a key strategic business partner to the Group CFO and the Group Management Team. The key areas of responsibility covers the preparation of Group Management and Board of Director Materials and requires a high business acumen and strong delivery of financial insights and analysis.
   

  

**Your Main Tasks Will Be**
* Take a leading role in the monthly/quarterly closing process and keep the overall process and business storyline together.
* Ensure high quality reporting to the management team, board and external stakeholders on regular basis and ad-hoc.
* Identify improvement areas and develop planning and forecasting process for the Group.
* Drive ad-hoc finance projects according to business plan and/or business requests.
* Partner with finance teams across the Group to meet existing financial deliverables and to continuously improve finance processes and common ways of working.


 The role reports to the Vice President Group Finance and is based in Solna, Stockholm.
   

  

 At Billerud, we put Safety First. Together we take great pride in our responsibility to contribute to a safe work environment. Please read more about our Safety First initiative
   

  

**Qualifications**
 To succeed in this position, we believe you have:
   

  

* Master’s degree in Finance, Economics, Business Administration or equivalent relevant area.
* 5+ years of experience as business controller or equivalent relevant area.
* Excellent skills in Excel, PowerPoint and preferably Power BI.
* Strong communication and presentation skills.
* Fluency in English and preferably Swedish.
* Experience from publicly listed companies is an advantage.


 Experience from the process or manufacturing industry is highly valued, as well as familiarity with the consolidation system Cognos or similar systems.
   

  

**Personal qualities**
 For us, personality is very important!
   

  

 Above all we believe You are a true team player with an intense drive, willingness to learn and a continuous improvement mindset!
   

  

**Furthermore, You Are**
**Analytical** 
 - With an eye for detail and the ability to interpret complex data, you can translate data into meaningful business insights that drive decision making.
   

  

**Agile** 
 - You can quickly understand and assess a situation and see improvement opportunities.
   

  

**Have a growth mindset** 
 - You love to explore new ideas and drive continuous improvement, not only to do your best work but to develop your capabilities and acquire new skills.
   

  

**Team player** 
 – committed to deliver on your tasks and supporting the team.
   

  

**Collaborative** 
 - You ask, and you listen, you take ideas on board and drive for constant improvement.
   

  

**A problem-solver** 
 - You see a challenge as an opportunity, and you are not afraid of “rolling-up the sleeves” to get into the details of solving a problem.
   

  

 Our values are very important for us and we believe that you recognize yourself in: Place customer in center, dare to innovate, lead the change and care for each other.
   

  

**Contact**
 If you would like to find out more about this position, please contact Julia Åkerlund, Talent Acquisition Partner, e-mail: julia.akerlund@billerud.com. Contact may be delayed during summer period.
   

  

 We decline suggestions from external recruitment partners.
   

  

**Application information**
 Welcome with your application no later than 2024-08-11. Rolling selection may occur in this process.
   

  

 Billerud is an equal opportunity employer. We embrace diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees and candidates.
   

  

**Why us?**
* Development and career opportunities
* An opportunity to contribute to a more sustainable future
* Performance-based bonus, occupational pension and a number of different benefits according to company policy.
* Opportunity to hybrid working according to company standard.


**Our recruitment process** 
 will include interviews, recruitment test, reference checks, alcohol- & drug test as well as background checks.
   

  

**Do you want to help create a sustainable future through your work?**
**Billerud is a world leading company in high-performing paper and packaging materials.** 
 We dare to innovate and put our customers in the center by developing sustainable alternatives that challenge the conventional in the packaging industry. Our commitment goes beyond products; it's about reshaping the way businesses and consumers perceive and use packaging to minimize environmental impact.
   

  

**We care for our people.** 
 Billerud is an international company with local roots. No matter where you work, we take pride in always making safety our number one priority.
   

  

**Realize your true value.** 
 At Billerud we lead the change in everything that we do. We have a strong focus on growth and development, offering diverse opportunities for employees to evolve professionally and personally.
   

  

**Join us in redefining sustainable packaging and drive meaningful change for a better tomorrow.**

title: Communications Director AstraZeneca Södertälje
description:
*Brinner du för engagerade medarbetare, teknik, produktion, AI, livslångt lärande och hållbarhetsfrågor? Slår ditt hjärta ett extraslag för Life Science och Sveriges framtid som industrination? Då kanske denna roll är något för dig!*
 Här på Campus AstraZeneca Södertälje, en av världens största tillverkningsenheter för läkemedel med ca 4 600 medarbetare, omvandlas nyskapande idéer till färdiga produkter, varje minut. Här är pulsen hög och vägarna många att utvecklas.
   

  

 Vi arbetar hållbart för varandra och planeten i en högteknologisk och positiv LEAN miljö. Campus Södertälje står för högteknologisk produktion av traditionella och biologiska läkemedel. Generell industrikunskap mixas med Life Science-expertis och spetsig IT-kompetens i en internationell miljö där coachande ledarskap och nyfikenhet driver oss mot att hitta nya sätt att tillverka läkemedel.
   

  

 Vi samarbetar för att tjäna ett gemensamt syfte: att förändra och förlänga liv genom att skapa framtidens läkemedel.
   

  

**Vill du landa på en plats där ditt driv och din nyfikenhet får utrymme? Vi längtar efter att välkomna dig till Campus AstraZeneca Södertälje!**
 Nu söker vi en dynamisk och utåtriktad person med dokumenterad passion för kommunikationsfrågor, som i nära samarbete med verksamheten vill ta ledningen för vår internkommunikation – och föra den in i framtiden. Även om det interna kommunikationsarbetet ligger i rollens fokus är vi en stor och viktig arbetsgivare i Sverige och globalt. Det innebär att vi ofta tar emot besökare från politik, näringsliv och akademi samt internt från andra delar av företaget. Därför ingår även uppgifter som tangerar PR- och externkommunikationsområdet och genomförs i nära samarbete med kollegorna i vår svenska Corporate Affairs-funktion i Stockholm och Göteborg.
   

  

**Din roll**
 Denna roll ingår i One Campus & SHE:s ledningsgrupp som har ett brett ansvar för samtliga medarbetare i Södertälje. Du rapporterar till chefen för campus och kommer att vara en viktig spelare i organisationens strategiska arbete.
   

  

 I din roll kommer du att leda det interna kommunikationsarbetet i Södertälje och därmed hantera ett brett spektrum av kommunikationsuppgifter, från strategisk planering till operativt arbete inklusive hantering av vår lokala kriskommunikation. Du kommer även ansvara för att våra kommunikationsprocesser och kommunikationskanaler fungerar effektivt med ett innehåll som är relevant, snyggt och uppdaterat. Ha en viktig roll i planeringen av olika evenemang och stötta verksamheten med budskapsunderlag, presentations- och bildmaterial. Skapa lokalt medarbetarengagemang och stolthet genom att placera globala nyheter och händelser lokal kontext, och genom att sprida vidare goda lokala exempel till en bredare publik.
   

  

 Du kommer vara ansvarig för att sätta den strategiska kommunikationsplanen för vårt campus i Södertälje – ett arbete du leder i nära samverkan med våra seniora ledningsgrupper. Fungera som rådgivare till verksamheten i kommunikationsfrågor och stöttar såväl vår Campus Lead som chefen för Sweden Operations i deras kommunikation
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 Utöver ett brinnande intresse för kommunikation och medarbetarengagemang tror vi att du tycker om att arbeta i kunskapsintensiva verksamheter - gärna med tidigare erfarenhet av life science eller teknikindustrin. Du kommer med bred erfarenhet från kommunikationsområdet och är en utåtriktad person med förmåga att ta själv ta initiativ och skapa de nätverk du behöver för att leverera din strategi. Du har samtidigt en stark egen motor och förmåga att arbeta självständigt. Du är lyhörd för din omgivning och är duktig på upprätthålla goda relationer och samverkan. Du är tydlig och kommunikativ och arbetar strukturerat. Du har lätt att ta till dig stora mängder information och utifrån den skapa budskap som tilltalar och inspirerar olika personalgrupper och intressenter, vilket i sann tidsanda leder oss in på nästa punkt – att du är intresserad av ny teknik och digitalisering inom kommunikationsområdet och redan har applicerat AI som en del i arbetet med att utveckla kommunikation i en verksamhet.
   

  

**Dina kvalifikationer**
* Universitets-/högskoleutbildning inom medie- och kommunikationsvetenskap, journalistik, PR/marknadskommunikation eller motsvarande
* Mycket goda kunskaper i engelska i både tal och skrift
* Vi ser gärna att du har erfarenhet av arbete i globalt storföretag och helst av både intern och extern kommunikation
* Tidigare erfarenhet av att hantera seniora intressenter, både internt och externt, är viktigt
* Tidigare erfarenhet av läkemedelsbranschen och/eller tillverkande industri är en fördel
* Du är van att ta fram budskap, speaker points, filmmanus, presentations- och bildmaterial och liknande
* Du har lätt för att skriva och är kan skapa lättillgänglig innehåll för alla typer av kanaler


**Känns det som att du är rätt person för** 
**att leda kommunikationsarbetet för vår verksamthet i Södertälje?**
**Så här går du vidare**
 Är du nyfiken att höra mer om tjänsten, kontakta rekryterande chef Nina Andrén på email nina.andren@astrazeneca.com
   

  

 Välkomen med din ansökan
 **senast 31 augusti, 2024**
**Varför AstraZeneca?**
 När vi på AstraZeneca ser chansen att förändras tar vi tillfället i akt - för varje möjlighet, oavsett hur liten, kan vara början på något stort. Att leverera medicin som förändrar människors liv handlar om att ha entreprenörsanda – att hitta stunderna och förstå dess potential. Därför söker vi dig som arbetar drivande både självständigt och i team, samt är duktig på att främja samarbete i hela organisationen. För genom ditt arbete kommer du kunna göra skillnad för patienters liv varje dag då du bidrar till att produktionen av livsnödvändiga mediciner kan fortlöpa.
   

  

 Vi på AstraZeneca välkomnar din positiva attityd och din vilja att utveckla både dig själv, ditt team och avdelningen. Du kommer få användning för ditt driv samt din förmåga att arbeta både noggrant och strukturerat även vid ett högt tempo. Vi belönar dig med ett närvarande ledarskap och omfattande förmåner.
   

  

**Mer information om vår verksamhet i Södertälje**
**Vårt Campus i Södertälje:** 
 https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZnE7s8j-dEM

title: Assistant Director / Director, Transaction Advisory
description:
**Director / Assistant Director** 




**Global Transaction Advisory Group** 




**Alvarez & Marsal** 




**Stockholm** 




  





**About us** 




 Alvarez & Marsal (“A&M”) is a global consulting firm with more than $3+ billion in revenues, c.9,000+ staff and over 80 offices worldwide. We offer a broad range of professional services including Restructuring, Transaction Advisory, Performance Improvement, Corporate Transformation, Financial Institutions Advisory, Tax, Valuations, and Disputes and Investigation Services.
 



  





 We would like to invite you to join Alvarez & Marsal’s dynamic Transaction Advisory team.
 



 Our award-winning practice includes over 1,000 professionals in over 40 offices across the United States, Middle East, Europe, Latin America, India and Asia Pacific. We work for premium clients on a selection of deals sector wide. Our Transactions Advisory team have established Alvarez & Marsal as one of the leading providers of financial due diligence globally and the leading firm to develop a fulfilling career in Transaction Advisory.
 



  





 Alvarez & Marsal’s employees benefit from joining a large network and employee resource groups such as supporting the LGBQT+ community, A&M Young Professionals, EMEA Women’s Network, The Multicultural Network, A&M Parents & Carers Community Group and offering support to those who identify as neurodivergent. Other benefits include but are not limited to flexible working, maternity / paternity leave and access to our Employee Assistance Programme. We are committed to creating a welcoming, diverse and inclusive environment for everyone.
 



  





**Our values** 




 Alvarez & Marsal’s core values lead the day-to-day decision-making practices, we work hard to uphold these values and remain true to our ethos of:
 


* *Integrity*
* *Objectivity*
* *Quality*
* *Inclusive Diversity*
* *Fun*
* *Personal Reward*



  





**What we do** 




 A&M provides investors and lenders the answers needed to get the deal done. We combine our firm’s deep operational, industry and functional resources with quality financial accounting and tax expertise to assess key deal drivers and focus on the root cause of any critical deal issues. The largest Transaction Advisory practice outside the Big Four, our global integrated teams help private equity, hedge fund and corporate acquirers unlock value across the investment cycle.
 



  





**The role** 




 We are growing and continue to expand our established Nordic team in Stockholm, we are looking to hire an Assistant Director / Director with experience in Transactions Advisory and who can support our Managing Directors and wider teams and can deliver on Swedish and pan European projects to our clients.
 



  





 As part of our highly skilled team, the successful individual will;
 



  




* Have the opportunity to internally network with our other service lines and attend external marketing events to build their professional community
* Engage
 
 teams and deliver focused Transaction Advisory projects, working closely with our Managing Directors
* Evaluate potential transactions in the context of a clients’ investment strategy
* Assist with financial due diligence and help to identify key risks against industry benchmarks
* Gain broad industry exposure working with a variety of large-cap and mid-cap private equity houses, corporate clients and financial institutions
* Expand the commercial aspects of your financial analysis skills and gain insight on key drivers and valuation considerations that drive a transaction
* Collaborate with operational and commercial professionals in combined project teams to enhance your knowledge of the broader due diligence and wider deal process
* Help develop junior colleagues while befitting from established formal and informal training programme and mentorship



  





 Alvarez & Marsal is an environment that presents a real opportunity for motivated individuals as all employees are encouraged to develop their client network and grow their business development skills. Our team is rewarded in terms of an attractive remuneration package and the opportunity to fast track their Transactions Advisory career.
 



  





 Our base salaries are highly competitive and bonuses are un-capped. Employees are rewarded for their contribution to growing both TAG and the broader business.
 



  





**Essential experience:** 



* Proven senior level experience in Transaction Advisory / Financial Due Diligence is essential in addition to experience across Private Equity and/ or blue-chip Corporates
* Qualified accountant and/or an exceptional academic record
* Trained at a Big 4 firm or an established Transaction Advisory (Transaction Services) practice
* Native in Swedish and fluent business level English is essential. Additional European language skills including French, German, Dutch, Italian or Spanish are highly desirable



  





 A&M’s deep operational and industry expertise provides TAG with a unique opportunity to perform more insightful due diligence by providing an integrated and differentiated approach enabling us to deliver more value to our clients. We are free from audit conflicts and our platform is less restrictive, enabling us to operate cross-border seamlessly.
 



  





**Diversity & Inclusion** 




 A&M’s entrepreneurial culture celebrates independent thinkers and doers who can positively impact our clients and shape our industry. The collaborative environment and engaging work—guided by A&M’s core values of Integrity, Quality, Objectivity, Fun, Personal Reward, and Inclusive Diversity—are the main reasons our people love working at A&M. Inclusive Diversity means we embrace diversity, and we foster inclusiveness, encouraging everyone to bring their whole self to work each day. It runs through how we recruit, develop employees, conduct business, support clients, and partner with vendors. It is the A&M way.
 



  





**Equal Opportunity Employer** 




 It is Alvarez & Marsal’s practice to provide and promote equal opportunity in employment, compensation, and other terms and conditions of employment without discrimination because of race, color, creed, religion, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, sex or gender, gender identity or gender expression (including transgender status), sexual orientation, marital status, military service and veteran status, physical or mental disability, family medical history, genetic information or other protected medical condition, political affiliation, or any other characteristic protected by and in accordance with applicable laws. Employees and Applicants can find A&M policy statements and additional information by region here.
 



  





**Unsolicited Resumes from Third-Party Recruiters** 




 Please note that as per A&M policy, we do not accept unsolicited resumes from third-party recruiters unless such recruiters are engaged to provide candidates for a specified opening and in alignment with our Inclusive Diversity values. Any employment agency, person or entity that submits an unsolicited resume does so with the understanding that A&M will have the right to hire that applicant at its discretion without any fee owed to the submitting employment agency, person or entity.

title: Group Business Controller
description:
**Job Description**
 At Billerud we believe that when we have tomorrow in mind, we will do our very best today. It is thanks to our employees that we are a world-leading company within the field of renewable paper and packaging materials. Do you want to realize your true value and work for a sustainable tomorrow? Join us!
   

  

**We are looking for a Group Business Controller to join our Group Finance function.**
 Group Finance is responsible for all Group controlling and reporting activities, performance management and a wide range of finance development projects throughout the company. The Group Business Control team is a key strategic business partner to the Group CFO and the Group Management Team. The key areas of responsibility covers the preparation of Group Management and Board of Director Materials and requires a high business acumen and strong delivery of financial insights and analysis.
   

  

**Your Main Tasks Will Be**
* Take an active role in the monthly/quarterly closing process, and thus pro-actively drive analysis and business insights generation to Group management.

* Maintain and develop the Group’s consolidation system including the continuous development of the reporting package.
* Partner with other corporate functions and the IT department to provide valuable analyses and drive performance.
* Partner with finance teams across the Group to meet existing financial deliverables and to continuously improve finance processes and common ways of working.

**A problem-solver** 
 - You see a challenge as an opportunity, and you are not afraid of “rolling-up the sleeves” to get into the details of solving a problem.
   

  

 Our values are very important for us and we believe that you recognize yourself in: Place customer in center, dare to innovate, lead the change and care for each other.
   

  

**Contact**
 If you would like to find out more about this position, please contact Julia Åkerlund, Talent Acquisition Partner, e-mail: julia.akerlund@billerud.com. Contact may be delayed during summer period.
   

  

 We decline suggestions from external recruitment partners.
   

  

**Application information**
 Welcome with your application no later than 2024-08-11. Rolling selection may occur in this process.
   

  

 Billerud is an equal opportunity employer. We embrace diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees and candidates.
   

  

**Why us?**
* Development and career opportunities
* An opportunity to contribute to a more sustainable future

**Our recruitment process** 
 will include interviews, recruitment test, reference checks, alcohol- & drug test as well as background checks.

Our commitment goes beyond products; it's about reshaping the way businesses and consumers perceive and use packaging to minimize environmental impact.

 At Billerud we lead the change in everything that we do. We have a strong focus on growth and development, offering diverse opportunities for employees to evolve professionally and personally.
